poem:
Title: "On Refuge's Shores"

On the day woven with luck and lore,
Sailed dreams bruised by stern war.
Good days outnumbered the scars,
While Ukraine's loss became California's stars. 

A charged sky, anew on the Golden plain,
From Donetsk to the Frisco Bay.
In resilience, they found their way,
Life's harsh river, softly designed to sway.
